item.title: 消息人士称，美国推动荷兰和日本限制向中国出口更多芯片制造设备
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周二告诉路透社，一位美国官员在与荷兰政府会晤后将前往日本，以推动盟国进一步打击中国生产尖端半导体的能力。【原文：A U.S. official was headed to Japan after meeting with the Dutch government in an effort to push allies to further crack down on China's ability to produce cutting-edge semiconductors, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞标：警惕通货紧缩的自满情绪
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体称美国证券交易委员会的决定可能有助于其获得 2.47 亿美元的资金
item.description: Trump Media & Technology Group 周二表示，美国证券交易委员会已宣布该公司转售部分股票和认股权证的申请生效，这可能给该公司带来约 2.47 亿美元的收益。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group said on Tuesday the Securities and Exchange Commission has declared effective the company's filing for resale of certain shares and warrants, potentially giving it about $247 million in proceeds.】

item.title: 产品日落之后，苹果转向第三方提供 "先买后付 "服务
item.description: 虽然苹果公司将停止去年推出的 "先买后付 "服务，但该公司仍在坚持这一产品，今年晚些时候将通过 Affirm 等第三方推出该服务的后续产品。【原文：Although Apple is discontinuing its buy now, pay later service launched last year, the company is sticking with the product, with a successor to the offering launching later this year via third-parties like Affirm .】

item.title: 西捷航空公司机械师工会发出 72 小时罢工通知
item.description: 飞机机械师兄弟会（Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association）工会周二表示，WestJet 航空公司的机械师向该公司发出了 72 小时罢工通知。【原文：WestJet Airlines' mechanics gave the carrier a 72-hour strike notice, the Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association union said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 知名分析师称底特律三大汽车制造商应退出中国市场
item.description: 一位知名汽车分析师周二表示，福特汽车和通用汽车等传统美国汽车制造商应退出中国市场，以便在成本高昂的电动汽车（EV）转型过程中保住资本。【原文：Legacy U.S. automakers such as Ford Motor and General Motors should leave the China market to preserve capital amid the costly electric vehicle (EV) transition, a leading auto analyst said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高通公司就销售和许可行为达成 750 万美元和解协议
item.description: 高通公司同意支付 7500 万美元，以解决股东指控该芯片制造商隐瞒反竞争销售和许可行为从而欺诈他们的诉讼。【原文：Qualcomm agreed to pay $75 million to resolve a lawsuit in which shareholders accused the chipmaker of defrauding them by hiding its anticompetitive sales and licensing practices.】

item.title: 亚马逊因加州仓库工人配额问题被罚款 590 万美元
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）被加州劳动监管机构处以 590 万美元的罚款，该监管机构称这家在线零售巨头未能正确告知工人两个仓库的生产率配额，其中一个仓库的一些工人正试图组织工会。【原文：Amazon.com has been fined $5.9 million by a California labor regulator who says the online retail giant failed to properly inform workers of productivity quotas at two warehouses, including one where some workers are trying to unionize.】

item.title: 美国国会预算办公室称，未来十年美国无保险人口比例将升至 8.9
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室周二发布的一份报告显示，受移民人数增加和联邦政府政策调整后 19-24 岁人群参保资格降低的影响，未来十年美国人的无保险率将从 2024 年的 7.7% 上升到 8.9%。【原文：The rate of Americans who are uninsured will rise to 8.9% over the next decade from 7.7% in 2024, driven by rising immigration and reduced eligibility for 19-to-24 year-olds following federal government policy changes, according to a Congressional Budget Office report released on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜耳短玉米新品种可抵御大风，但风速不超过 100 英里/小时
item.description: 拜耳公司周二表示，在一些试验中，拜耳的 Preceon 矮秆玉米品种已被证明能够抵御时速高达 75 英里（120 公里/小时）的大风，但无法抵御时速超过 100 英里的大风。【原文：Bayer's Preceon variety of short stature corn has been shown to withstand up to 75 mph winds (120 kph) in some trials, the company said on Tuesday, but could not withstand winds over 100 mph.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会将针对 TikTok 的投诉移交给司法部
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周二表示，已将针对社交媒体平台 TikTok 及其母公司 ByteDance 可能违反《儿童网络隐私法》的投诉提交司法部。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Tuesday it had referred a complaint to the Justice Department against the social media platform TikTok and its parent company ByteDance over potential violations of the Children's Online Privacy Act.】

item.title: J&J 遭受新的滑石粉集体诉讼，要求对癌症进行医疗监测
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）正面临一项新的集体诉讼提案，该提案旨在代表那些因使用该公司生产的婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品而被诊断出患有癌症或将来可能患上癌症的妇女，寻求损害赔偿和医疗监控。【原文：Johnson & Johnson is facing a new proposed class action seeking damages and medical monitoring on behalf of women who have been diagnosed with cancer, or might develop it in the future, allegedly as a result of using the company's baby powder and other talc products.】

item.title: 福特测试从墨西哥瓜伊马斯港口运输汽车以降低物流成本
item.description: 本周二，福特公司从其位于墨西哥北部索诺拉州的工厂附近一度被忽视的瓜伊马斯港口运出了第一批汽车，该项目如果全面启动，将使福特公司的物流成本降低 30%。【原文：Ford shipped out its first batch of cars from the once-ignored Guaymas port near its plant in the northern Mexican state of Sonora on Tuesday, in a project that, if fully launched, could cut its logistics costs by 30%.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司将印度、沙特阿拉伯、欧盟和美国视为战略防务市场
item.description: 巴西航空工业公司 巴西航空工业公司防务部门负责人周二表示，该公司希望扩大 C-390 千年型飞机的销售，并将印度、沙特阿拉伯、欧盟和美国视为其防务部门的战略市场。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer sees India, Saudi Arabia, the European Union and the United States as strategic markets for its defense unit as it looks to expand sales of the C-390 Millennium, the head of Embraer Defense said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 人工智能热推动英伟达成为全球最有价值公司
item.description: 随着英伟达（Nvidia）股价的惊人上涨，该公司已成为全球最有价值的公司，这凸显了投资者对人工智能在未来几年全球经济中将发挥的巨大作用的预期。【原文：Nvidia has become the world’s most valuable company following a staggering rally in its shares, underlining the outsized role investors expect artificial intelligence to play in the global economy over coming years.】

item.title: 巨额科技 ETF 将购买 100 亿美元英伟达股票
item.description: 全球最大的科技基金之一将加大对英伟达（Nvidia）的投资，该公司在股价大涨后已成为全球最有价值的公司。【原文：One of the world’s largest technology funds is set to ramp up its exposure to Nvidia , which has become the world's most valuable company following a blistering run in its shares.】

item.title: 美联储可以 "耐心等待"，但需要更多良好的通胀数据：洛根
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）周二表示，最近的数据显示通胀正在降温，这是一个 "值得欢迎的消息"，但美国央行可以在利率政策上保持耐心。【原文：Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Lorie Logan on Tuesday said recent data showing inflation is cooling is "welcome news" but that the U.S. central bank can stay patient on interest-rate policy.】

item.title: CBO 预计，在支出增加的情况下，2024 财年美国赤字将跃升至 19 亿美元
item.description: 美国国会预算办公室周二称，2024 财年美国预算赤字将跃升至 1.915 万亿美元，超过去年的 1.695 万亿美元，成为 COVID-19 时代以外的最大赤字，理由是学生贷款、医疗补助、银行倒闭成本以及对乌克兰和以色列的援助等支出增加。【原文：The U.S. budget deficit will jump to $1.915 trillion for fiscal 2024, topping last year's $1.695 trillion gap as the largest outside the COVID-19 era, the Congressional Budget Office said on Tuesday, citing increased outlays for student loans, Medicaid, bank failure costs and aid to Ukraine and Israel.】

item.title: 新泽西州对沃尔玛店内定价行为处以罚款
item.description: 全球最大的零售商沃尔玛同意支付 164 万美元，以了结监管部门对其新泽西州 64 家门店采用非法定价手段，使消费者难以比较购物的指控。【原文：Walmart , the world's largest retailer, agreed to pay $1.64 million to settle regulatory charges that its 64 New Jersey stores employed illegal pricing practices that made it hard for consumers to comparison-shop.】

item.title: Meta 必须面对澳大利亚亿万富翁福雷斯特因 Facebook 加密货币广告骗局而在美国提起的诉讼
item.description: 一名美国法官驳回了 Meta Platforms 提出的驳回亿万富翁、澳大利亚矿业巨头安德鲁-福雷斯特（Andrew Forrest）在 Facebook 上的诈骗广告诉讼的请求，这些广告显示他在推销虚假加密货币和其他欺诈性投资。【原文：A U.S. judge rejected Meta Platforms' bid to dismiss a lawsuit by billionaire Australian mining magnate Andrew Forrest over scam Facebook advertisements that show him promoting fake cryptocurrency and other fraudulent investments.】

item.title: 瑞银美洲新兴市场首席投资官称拉美投资组合 "必须 "配置拉美资产
item.description: 瑞银全球财富管理公司（UBS Global Wealth Management）美洲新兴市场首席投资官表示，一连串的政治改革和经济周期使阿根廷美元主权债券和拉美公司债券跻身主要 "关注领域"。【原文：A spate of political reforms and economic cycles has elevated Argentinian dollar-denominated sovereign bonds and Latin American corporate bonds to rank among key "areas of interest," the chief investment officer of emerging markets Americas at UBS Global Wealth Management said.】

item.title: VIEW 英伟达成为全球最有价值公司
item.description: 本周二，英伟达公司（Nvidia）成为全球最有价值的公司，取代了重量级科技公司微软（Microsoft），其芯片继续在人工智能市场的竞争中发挥核心作用。【原文：Nvidia became the world's most valuable company on Tuesday, dethroning tech heavyweight Microsoft , as its chips continue to play a central role in a race to dominate the market for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称监管问题阻止了瑞士宝盛与 EFG 的收购谈判
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社，瑞士监管机构的担忧阻碍了瑞士宝盛和 EFG International 两家私人银行就价值约 150 亿瑞士法郎（约合 170 亿美元）的潜在合作进行的谈判。【原文：Swiss regulatory concerns scuppered talks between private banks Julius Baer and EFG International over a potential tie-up worth some 15 billion Swiss francs ($17 billion), two sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储主席穆萨勒姆在首次演讲中发出谨慎降息的信号
item.description: 美国圣路易斯联储主席阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆周二在担任该地区联储银行行长以来首次就货币政策发表公开评论时说，美国央行只有在通胀下降、需求放缓和供应扩大的 "几个月后，更可能是几个季度后 "才应开始降息。【原文：The U.S. central bank should only start to cut interest rates after "months, and more likely quarters" of falling inflation, moderating demand and expanding supply, St. Louis Federal Reserve President Alberto Musalem said on Tuesday, in his first public comments on monetary policy since becoming head of the regional Fed bank.】

item.title: 受近期数据 "鼓舞"，美联储主席库格勒期待今年晚些时候降息
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会理事阿德里安娜-库格勒周二表示，通胀正呈现出令人鼓舞的降温迹象，尽管目前的通胀率仍然过高，但只要经济状况继续朝着 "正确的方向 "发展，今年晚些时候降息将是合适的。【原文：Inflation is exhibiting encouraging signs of cooling, U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said on Tuesday, and although it is still too high, as long as economic conditions continue moving in "the right direction" it will be appropriate to cut interest rates later this year.】

item.title: 英伟达成为全球最有价值公司
item.description: 本周二，英伟达公司（Nvidia）成为全球最有价值的公司，取代了重量级科技公司微软（Microsoft），其芯片继续在人工智能市场的竞争中发挥核心作用。【原文：Nvidia became the world's most valuable company on Tuesday, dethroning tech heavyweight Microsoft , as its chips continue to play a central role in a race to dominate the market for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: HPE 首席执行官发布旨在帮助企业的 "简单 "人工智能硬件
item.description: 惠普企业公司首席执行官安东尼奥-内里（Antonio Neri）在周二举行的拉斯维加斯会议上向有意部署各种形式人工智能的企业推介了一系列新的硬件、软件和服务。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise CEO Antonio Neri pitched a new line of hardware, software and services to businesses interested in deploying various forms of artificial intelligence at its Las Vegas conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: 参议员称美国需要 "加强 "对中国科技活动的追踪
item.description: 参议院情报委员会主席周二表示，美国情报机构需要更好地追踪中国的先进技术和其他各领域的努力。【原文：The chair of the Senate Intelligence Committee said on Tuesday that U.S. intelligence agencies need to do a better job in tracking Chinese advanced technology and other efforts across a variety of fields.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，苹果暂停下一款高端耳机的研发工作，专注于廉价机型
item.description: 据 The Information 周二援引一家为 Vision Pro 生产关键部件的制造商的一名员工的话报道，苹果公司已经暂停了下一代高端 Vision 头戴式耳机的研发工作。【原文：Apple has suspended work on its next high-end Vision headset, the Information reported on Tuesday, citing an employee at a manufacturer that makes key components for the Vision Pro.】

item.title: 特斯拉必须面对车主声称其垄断汽车维修和零部件的诉讼
item.description: 一名美国法官表示，特斯拉车主可以提起集体诉讼，指控亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的电动汽车公司垄断维修和零部件市场，这为她去年 11 月驳回的诉讼注入了新的活力。【原文：A U.S. judge said Tesla vehicle owners can pursue a proposed class action accusing billionaire Elon Musk's electric car company of monopolizing markets for repairs and parts, breathing new life into a lawsuit she dismissed last November.】
